message.content:
{"id": "11314", 
"title": "Bug 11314: Replace package name fragments should always be smaller", 
"description": "", 
"OB": "In the 'Replace package name fragments with:' field in the preferences (Java Work in progress), when I enter 'com.ibm.foobar', it gets replaced with 'co~.ib~.foobar'. However, I believe that package name compression should only replace a fragment if the compressed name is actually smaller. In this case, 'com.' should not be replaced because 'co~.' is the same length and contains less information.", 
"EB": "Bug 11314: Replace package name fragments should always be smaller. In the 'Replace package name fragments with:' field in the preferences (Java Work in progress), when I enter 'com.ibm.foobar', it gets replaced with 'co~.ib~.foobar'. However, I believe that package name compression should only replace a fragment if the compressed name is actually smaller. In this case, 'com.' should not be replaced because 'co~.' is the same length and contains less information.", 
"SR": "Ensure that the package name compression feature in the 'Replace package name fragments with:' field in the preferences (Java Work in progress) only replaces a fragment if the compressed name is smaller."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
